global:
Usage: playwright-cli <command> [args] [options]

Core:
  open <url>                  open url
  close                       close the page
  type <text>                 type text into editable element
  click <ref> [button]        perform click on a web page
  dblclick <ref> [button]     perform double click on a web page
  fill <ref> <text>           fill text into editable element
  drag <startRef> <endRef>    perform drag and drop between two elements
  hover <ref>                 hover over element on page
  select <ref> <vals>         select an option in a dropdown
  upload <file>               upload one or multiple files
  check <ref>                 check a checkbox or radio button
  uncheck <ref>               uncheck a checkbox or radio button
  snapshot                    capture page snapshot to obtain element ref
  eval <func> [ref]           evaluate javascript expression on page or element
  dialog-accept [prompt]      accept a dialog
  dialog-dismiss              dismiss a dialog
  resize <w> <h>              resize the browser window

Navigation:
  go-back                     go back to the previous page
  go-forward                  go forward to the next page
  reload                      reload the current page

Keyboard:
  key-press <key>             press a key on the keyboard, `a`, `arrowleft`
  key-down <key>              press a key down on the keyboard
  key-up <key>                press a key up on the keyboard

Mouse:
  mouse-move <x> <y>          move mouse to a given position
  mouse-down [button]         press mouse down
  mouse-up [button]           press mouse up
  mouse-wheel <dx> <dy>       scroll mouse wheel

Save as:
  screenshot [ref]            screenshot of the current page or element
  pdf                         save page as pdf

Tabs:
  tab-list                    list all tabs
  tab-new [url]               create a new tab
  tab-close [index]           close a browser tab
  tab-select <index>          select a browser tab

DevTools:
  console [min-level]         list console messages
  network                     list all network requests since loading the page
  run-code <code>             run playwright code snippet
  tracing-start               start trace recording
  tracing-stop                stop trace recording

commands.open:
playwright-cli open <url>

Open URL

Arguments:
  <url>                       the url to navigate to
Options:
  --headed                    run browser in headed mode
commands.type:
playwright-cli type <text>

Type text into editable element

Arguments:
  <text>                      text to type into the element
Options:
  --submit                    whether to submit entered text (press enter after)
commands.click:
playwright-cli click <ref> [button]

Perform click on a web page

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
  [button]                    button to click, defaults to left
Options:
  --modifiers                 modifier keys to press
commands.dblclick:
playwright-cli dblclick <ref> [button]

Perform double click on a web page

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
  [button]                    button to click, defaults to left
Options:
  --modifiers                 modifier keys to press
commands.fill:
playwright-cli fill <ref> <text>

Fill text into editable element

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
  <text>                      text to fill into the element
Options:
  --submit                    whether to submit entered text (press enter after)
commands.drag:
playwright-cli drag <startRef> <endRef>

Perform drag and drop between two elements

Arguments:
  <startRef>                  exact source element reference from the page snapshot
  <endRef>                    exact target element reference from the page snapshot
Options:
  --headed                    run browser in headed mode
commands.hover:
playwright-cli hover <ref>

Hover over element on page

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
commands.select:
playwright-cli select <ref> <vals>

Select an option in a dropdown

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
  <vals>                      array of values to select in the dropdown. this can be a single value or multiple values.
commands.upload:
playwright-cli upload <file>

Upload one or multiple files

Arguments:
  <file>                      the absolute paths to the files to upload
commands.check:
playwright-cli check <ref>

Check a checkbox or radio button

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
commands.uncheck:
playwright-cli uncheck <ref>

Uncheck a checkbox or radio button

Arguments:
  <ref>                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
commands.snapshot:
playwright-cli snapshot 

Capture page snapshot to obtain element ref

Options:
  --filename                  save snapshot to markdown file instead of returning it in the response.
commands.eval:
playwright-cli eval <func> [ref]

Evaluate JavaScript expression on page or element

Arguments:
  <func>                      () => { /* code */ } or (element) => { /* code */ } when element is provided
  [ref]                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot
commands.console:
playwright-cli console [min-level]

List console messages

Arguments:
  [min-level]                 level of the console messages to return. each level includes the messages of more severe levels. defaults to "info".
Options:
  --clear                     whether to clear the console list
commands.dialog-accept:
playwright-cli dialog-accept [prompt]

Accept a dialog

Arguments:
  [prompt]                    the text of the prompt in case of a prompt dialog.
commands.resize:
playwright-cli resize <w> <h>

Resize the browser window

Arguments:
  <w>                         width of the browser window
  <h>                         height of the browser window
commands.go-back:
playwright-cli go-back 

Go back to the previous page
commands.go-forward:
playwright-cli go-forward 

Go forward to the next page
commands.reload:
playwright-cli reload 

Reload the current page
commands.key-press:
playwright-cli key-press <key>

Press a key on the keyboard, `a`, `ArrowLeft`

Arguments:
  <key>                       name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `arrowleft` or `a`
commands.key-down:
playwright-cli key-down <key>

Press a key down on the keyboard

Arguments:
  <key>                       name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `arrowleft` or `a`
commands.key-up:
playwright-cli key-up <key>

Press a key up on the keyboard

Arguments:
  <key>                       name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `arrowleft` or `a`
commands.mouse-move:
playwright-cli mouse-move <x> <y>

Move mouse to a given position

Arguments:
  <x>                         x coordinate
  <y>                         y coordinate
commands.mouse-down:
playwright-cli mouse-down [button]

Press mouse down

Arguments:
  [button]                    button to press, defaults to left
commands.mouse-up:
playwright-cli mouse-up [button]

Press mouse up

Arguments:
  [button]                    button to press, defaults to left
commands.mouse-wheel:
playwright-cli mouse-wheel <dx> <dy>

Scroll mouse wheel

Arguments:
  <dx>                        y delta
  <dy>                        x delta
commands.screenshot:
playwright-cli screenshot [ref]

screenshot of the current page or element

Arguments:
  [ref]                       exact target element reference from the page snapshot.
Options:
  --filename                  file name to save the screenshot to. defaults to `page-{timestamp}.{png|jpeg}` if not specified.
  --fullPage                  when true, takes a screenshot of the full scrollable page, instead of the currently visible viewport.
commands.pdf:
playwright-cli pdf 

Save page as PDF

Options:
  --filename                  file name to save the pdf to. defaults to `page-{timestamp}.pdf` if not specified.
commands.tab-new:
playwright-cli tab-new [url]

Create a new tab

Arguments:
  [url]                       the url to navigate to in the new tab. if omitted, the new tab will be blank.
commands.tab-close:
playwright-cli tab-close [index]

Close a browser tab

Arguments:
  [index]                     tab index. if omitted, current tab is closed.
commands.tab-select:
playwright-cli tab-select <index>

Select a browser tab

Arguments:
  <index>                     tab index
commands.network:
playwright-cli network 

List all network requests since loading the page

Options:
  --static                    whether to include successful static resources like images, fonts, scripts, etc. defaults to false.
  --clear                     whether to clear the network list
commands.run-code:
playwright-cli run-code <code>

Run Playwright code snippet

Arguments:
  <code>                      a javascript function containing playwright code to execute. it will be invoked with a single argument, page, which you can use for any page interaction.
